archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection contains a single scrapbook of photographs of VPI and the area surrounding Blacksburg, Virginia, from about 1912 to 1916.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Virginia Tech Scrapbook must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Virginia Tech Scrapbook, 1912-1916, Ms2009-079 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Virginia Tech Scrapbook was donated to Special Collections in 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Virginia Tech Scrapbook commenced and was completed in May 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The scrapbook may have been compiled by Mary Katherine Cook Derring, but no biographical information is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a scrapbook with more than 100 photographs of Blacksburg, Virginia, and VPI activities. Photographs are dated between 1912 and 1916. Most are captioned. Many depict the Corps of Cadets and their campus activities, as well as the growth of the campus in the period.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically. The photographs in the scrapbook were, for the most part, arranged chronologically by the creator, and the scrapbook has been left in its original order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional photographs of Virginia Tech and its history, as well as those of Blacksburg, Virginia, and the surrounding areas are available on Imagebase and in the University Archives Photograph Collections.
